slidelink.displaytext: Choose the continent where the Renaissance began.
What is the name of the ancient land route used for trade between Europe and Asia? Hint: a type of cloth _ _ _ k Route
This banker was an important patron and supporter of innovative people during the Renaissance.
was an important patron in the Renaissance.
Nicolaus Copernicus used _____________ to do his research to prove that the Earth revolves around the Sun.
Match the paintings and the artists. Use this link to check.
The author in the previous slide was __________________.
Hernan Cortes was the Spanish explorer responsible for the defeat of the Aztec people in this continent.
of central America were totally defeated by the Spanish explorer Hernan Cortes who was searching for gold and riches.
The spread of ideas: The Printing Press
Johannes Gutenberg invented the printing press.
Unlock the code: “K L O B N Z G S”
Ciphers in the Renaissance: Break the code

search.slidetext: renaissance and exploration you have 70 minutes to complete the “escape”. the fastest team has done a great job but the best collaboration wins. ms. karishma and ms. aisha can stop the game and/or disqualify a team for not following rules. find the combination to unlock the final question. use your unit 2 resources (shared by ms. karishma) to solve the clues. you may use other websites, but no google searches. note down all the red letters in the same order that they will appear in. keep a notebook ready! all the best! escape room!

ciphers in the renaissance: break the code a b c d e f g h i j k l m z y x w v u t s r q p o n communication in codes and ciphers developed a lot in renaissance europe. “leon battista alberti, an italian renaissance author, artist, architect, athlete, philosopher, and all-around renaissance man” (holden, 2017, p. 36) developed complex codes for communicating important information. this renaissance polymath is considered to be the “father of western cryptography”. cryptography is “writing in code”. use the cipher below to unveil your escape code. one clue is added in red. the letters spell a word on this slide.

incorrect that is incorrect. please try again. try again try again try again try again try again try again incorrect nope, you have one more try! continue continue continue continue continue continue correct wonderful! continue continue continue continue continue continue polymath polymath polymath polymath polymath polymath geniuses geniuses geniuses geniuses geniuses geniuses scientist scientist scientist scientist scientist scientist scholar scholar scholar scholar scholar scholar unlock the code: “k l o b n z g s”
polymath: a person who knows a lot about many different subjects artist anatomist scientist engineer inventor musician

continue continue continue continue continue continue the renaissance began in europe. check where europe is. incorrect correct that's right! you selected the correct response. continue continue continue continue continue continue choose the continent where the renaissance began. once you are sure, click submit. you have only one try.

the ottoman empire (watch the gif) formed in 1299 ce expanded in all directions controlled all the land routes between europe and asia the european states and the ottoman empire were not friendly with each other. the ottoman empire led to the need for sea-routes. more information: (detailed) world history – ottoman empire (easy) ducksters – ottoman empire

incorrect the silk route was used for land-based-trade. there were sea-routes at the time but land was safer. continue continue continue continue continue continue correct that’s right! the silk route was used for land-based-trade. there were sea-routes at the time but land was safer. continue continue continue continue continue continue what is the name of the ancient land route used for trade between europe and asia? hint: a type of cloth _ _ _ k route
after 1493 (15th century), the land-based silk route could not be used by the europeans easily. sea-routes needed to be found for trade.
patrons and supporters rulers e.g. queen elizabeth i (england) religious leaders/rulers e.g. pope julius ii (rome, italy) wealthy familiese.g. de medicis (florence, italy)

incorrect the medici family was a very wealthy banking family. lorenzo de’ medici took a great interest in supporting artists. continue continue continue continue continue continue correct that's right! you selected the correct response. continue continue continue continue continue continue lorenzo de' medici lorenzo de' medici lorenzo de' medici lorenzo de' medici lorenzo de' medici lorenzo de' medici cosimo de' medici cosimo de' medici cosimo de' medici cosimo de' medici cosimo de' medici cosimo de' medici queen elizabeth i queen elizabeth i queen elizabeth i queen elizabeth i queen elizabeth i queen elizabeth i leonardo da vinci leonardo da vinci leonardo da vinci leonardo da vinci leonardo da vinci leonardo da vinci this banker was an important patron and supporter of innovative people during the renaissance.
lorenzo de’ medici was an important patron in the renaissance. source: https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=igxwmqdchwe

nicolaus copernicus: scientific innovation expert mathematician, astronomer, physician, greek and roman literature scholar, translator, governor, diplomat, and economist his house had a tower from where he would watch the skies. before copernicus, people thought the sun revolved around the earth.

incorrect you did not select the correct response. continue continue continue continue continue continue correct that's right! you selected the correct response. continue continue continue continue continue continue nicolaus copernicus used _____________ to do his research to prove that the earth revolves around the sun. media interview survey observation
observation nicolaus copernicus used regular to prove his theory that the earth rotates around the sun. he had support from a wealthy member of his family.
primavera the last supper arnolfini wedding portrait school of athens

incorrect you did not select the correct response. continue continue continue continue continue continue correct that's right! you selected the correct response. continue continue continue continue continue continue match the paintings and the artists. use this link to check. primavera boticelli arnolfini wedding jan van eyck the last supper leonardo da vinci the school of athens raphael
virtual visit: the globe theatre (easy) ducksters – william shakespeare rulers e.g. queen elizabeth i (england) support and patronage plays: hamlet, othello, king lear, macbeth, etc. and poems

writer of fiction and non-fiction! italian diplomat, author, philosopher and historian in florence after the medici period wrote the prince (in about 1513 but not published until 1532. “the father of modern political philosophy and political science” senior official in the florentine republic – diplomatic and military affairs wrote comedies, carnival songs, and poetry his letters are also important to historians and scholars

incorrect you did not select the correct response. continue continue continue continue continue continue correct that's right! you selected the correct response. continue continue continue continue continue continue the author in the previous slide was __________________.

niccolo machiavelli italian diplomat, author, philosopher and historian in florence after the medici period wrote the prince (in about 1513 but not published until 1532. “the father of modern political philosophy and political science” senior official in the florentine republic – diplomatic and military affairs wrote comedies, carnival songs, and poetry his letters are also important to historians and scholars
ship source: naval encyclopedia (by david bocquelet, france) history year by year. dorling kindersley limited, 2011. setting sail

incorrect the aztec were the native or original inhabitants of central america. continue continue continue continue continue continue correct correct! the aztecs were the original inhabitants of mexico. continue continue continue continue continue continue hernan cortes was the spanish explorer responsible for the defeat of the aztec people in this continent.
the aztecs of central america were totally defeated by the spanish explorer hernan cortes who was searching for gold and riches.

the spread of ideas: the printing press the impact of the printing press in europe included: increase in how many books could be produced more people could access books (more books, lower cost) more authors (including women) were published and successful books earned authors money common languages used for printing instead of latin better literacy and more public libraries ideas spread quickly and social movements became easier to organise (e.g. (1) martin luther and protestantism; (2) jesuit movement) the catholic church and political leaders started to ban books and ideas

incorrect you did not select the correct response. continue continue continue continue continue continue correct that's right! you selected the correct response. continue continue continue continue continue continue true true true true true true false false false false false false johannes gutenberg invented the printing press. source: why martin luther was an early media revolutionary here’s a print-out of my complaints!
